get.summary: List the cross account requests for a user or account
get.description: By default, responses are sorted in ascending order by created_at

parameters.name: query_by
parameters.description: Parameter for filtering resource by either a user's ID, or a client's org. The default value is target_org.

parameters.name: account
parameters.description: Parameter for filtering resource by an account number. Value can be a comma-separated list of ids. To be used in tandem with ?query_by=user_id to further filter a user's requests by account number.

parameters.name: org_id
parameters.description: Parameter for filtering resource by an org id. Value can be a comma-separated list of ids. To be used in tandem with ?query_by=user_id to further filter a user's requests by org id.

parameters.name: approved_only
parameters.description: Parameter for filtering resource which have been approved.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Parameter for filtering resource based on status.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Parameter for ordering by field. For inverse ordering, use '-', e.g. ?order_by=-start_date.

200.description: A paginated list of cross account request objects

403.description: Insufficient permissions to list cross account requests

201.description: An object describing the cross account request

403.description: Insufficient permissions to create cross account request

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: ID of cross account request to get

parameters.description: Parameter for filtering resource by either a user's ID, or a client's org. The default value is target_org.

parameters.name: account

get.summary: List the principals for a tenant
get.description: By default, responses are sorted in ascending order by username

parameters.name: match_criteria
parameters.description: Parameter for specifying the matching criteria for an object's name and/or email. Currently, match_criteria of partial searches for a username/email using "starts with" pattern.

parameters.name: usernames
parameters.description: Comma separated usernames of principals to get. If match_criteria is specified, only the first username will be picked up for search.

parameters.name: sort_order
parameters.description: The sort order of the query, either ascending or descending. Defaults to ascending.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: E-mail address of principal to search for. Could be combined with match_criteria for searching.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Set the status of users to get back.

parameters.name: admin_only
parameters.description: Get only admin users within an account. Setting this would ignore the parameters: usernames, email

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Parameter for ordering principals by value. For inverse ordering, supply '-' before the param value, such as: ?order_by=-username

parameters.name: username_only
parameters.description: Parameter for optionally returning only usernames for principals, bypassing a call to IT.

post.summary: Create a group in a tenant

get.summary: List the groups for a tenant
get.description: By default, responses are sorted in ascending order by group name

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: A username for a principal to filter for groups

parameters.name: exclude_username
parameters.description: A username for a principal to filter for groups where principal is not a member and can be added manually

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: A list of UUIDs to filter listed groups.

parameters.name: role_names
parameters.description: List of role name to filter for groups. It is exact match but case-insensitive

parameters.name: role_discriminator
parameters.description: Discriminator that works with role_names to indicate matching all/any of the role names

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Parameter for ordering groups by value. For inverse ordering, supply '-' before the param value, such as: ?order_by=-name

parameters.name: platform_default
parameters.description: An optional flag to return either platform default or non-platform default groups.

parameters.name: admin_default
parameters.description: An optional flag to return either admin default or non-admin default groups.

parameters.name: system
parameters.description: An optional flag to return either system or non-system groups.

200.description: A paginated list of group objects

get.summary: Get the permitted access for a principal in the tenant (defaults to principal from the identity header)
get.description: Access responses are sorted in ascending order by an ID internal to the database

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: The application name(s) to obtain access for the principal. This is an exact match. When no application is supplied, all permissions for the principal are returned. You may also use a comma-separated list to match on multiple applications.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Unique username of the principal to obtain access for (only available for admins, and if supplied, takes precedence over the identity header).

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Parameter for ordering roles by value. For inverse ordering, supply '-' before the param value, such as: ?order_by=-application

200.description: A paginated list of access objects

get.summary: List the permissions for a tenant
get.description: By default, responses are sorted in ascending order by permission application.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Parameter for ordering permissions by value. For inverse ordering, supply '-' before the param value, such as: ?order_by=-application

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: Exact match for the application name of a permission. You may also use a comma-separated list to match on multiple applications.

parameters.name: resource_type
parameters.description: Exact match for the resource type name of a permission. You may also use a comma-separated list to match on multiple resource_types.

parameters.name: verb
parameters.description: Exact match for the operation verb name of a permission You may also use a comma-separated list to match on multiple verbs.

parameters.name: permission
parameters.description: Partial match for the aggregate permission value name of a permission object.

parameters.name: exclude_globals
parameters.description: If set to 'true', this will exclude any permission with a global allowance on either 'application', 'resource_type' or 'verb'. The default is 'false'.

parameters.name: exclude_roles
parameters.description: An optional string filter which accepts one or more role UUIDs, comma-separated, to return permissions not associated with the supplied role(s).

parameters.name: allowed_only
parameters.description: If set to 'true', this will exclude any permission with a role where the 'application' is not in the role create allow list.

200.description: A paginated list of permission objects

get.summary: List the available options for fields of permissions for a tenant
get.description: By default, options of application is returned. And could be resource_type or verb on demand.

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: specify which fields of permission to display

parameters.name: application
parameters.description: Filter returned options based on application. You may also use a comma-separated list to filter on multiple applications.

parameters.name: resource_type
parameters.description: Filter returned options based on resource_type. You may also use a comma-separated list to filter on multiple resource_types.

parameters.name: verb
parameters.description: Filter returned options based on verb. You may also use a comma-separated list to filter on multiple verbs.

parameters.name: exclude_globals
parameters.description: If set to 'true', this will exclude any permission option with a global allowance on the supplied '?field=' value of 'application', 'resource_type' or 'verb'. The default is 'false'.

parameters.name: allowed_only
parameters.description: If set to 'true', this will exclude any permission with a role where the 'application' is not in the role create allow list.

200.description: A list of options for field of permission
